result.execSummary:
The defendant Donna J Lehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donna J Lehr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donna J Lehr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Donna J Lehr was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Donna J Lehr was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Donna J Lehr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Donna J Lehr in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF76,14CF77, 14CF78, 14CF84, 14CM53.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court is satisfied will accept waiver.  DE will enter a plea of NC to 14CF59 Ct's-3,4,5,6 and 14CM53-modifers will be dismissed.  14CF84 will be a DAGP for a  year period.  14CF76,14CF77,14CF78 will be dismissed but read in.  
Withhold sentence place on probation for a 2 yr period.  DE will pay CC/Rest.  
14CF84-DE will enter a plea of NC, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  DE must comply with all conditions of the DAGP, if successful count shall be dismissed.  
14CF59- CT 3,4,5,6-enter a plea of NC Dismiss modifiers in Ct 6. 
14CM53-NC plea, dismiss enhancers.  
Court will accept plea's and find the DE guilty.  Court will order sentence withheld, 2 years probation on each count, concurrent, will pay court costs and restitution.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on December 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.
